document.masterDocTitle: Three new species of thegenus Tartessus Stål (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Tartessinae) from Vietnam

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Three new species of thegenus Tartessus Stål (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Tartessinae) from Vietnam

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–6.
Tartessus iridescens
sp. n.
, paratypes. 1—male (Binh Chau-Phuoc Buu National Park), lateral view; 2—same, dorsal view; 3—same, face; 4—male (Cat Tien National Park), apex of hind tibia and metatarsomeres, ventral view; 5—female (Binh Chau-Phuoc Buu National Park), sternite VII and ovipositor, ventral view; 6—male (Binh Chau-Phuoc Buu National Park), genital block, lateral view. Total length of male—9.0 mm, female—10.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Female genitalia ( Fig. 5 ).
Sternite VII hind margin sharply concave medially. Ovipositor valvulae slightly surpassing pygofer lobes (in lateral view).
Total length. Males—8.0– 9.4 mm . Females—10.0–11.0 mm.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 7–9.
Tartessus iridescens
sp. n.
, paratypes. 7—female (Cat Tien National Park), apex of left hind tibia and metatarsomeres, ventral view; 8—male (Binh Chau-Phuoc Buu National Park), antenna; 9—female (Cat Tien National Park), fore wing, dorsal view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Etymology. The species name is derived from the Latin “
iridéscens
” means iridescent and refers to the multicoloured, head, pro- and mesonotum.

Holotype : male, Vietnam , Ðồng Nai Province , Cat Tien National Park , 11˚25΄ N 107˚25΄ E,

, A.F. Emeljanov leg.

Biology. In Binh Chau-Phuoc Buu National Park the species was collected by sweeping in dry
Dipterocarpus
forest, often from low trees, e.g.
Ficus
sp., at forest edges ( Figs 19, 20 ). It was collected by light trapping in Cat Tien National Park.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 10–18.
Tartessus iridescens
sp. n.
, male genitalia. 10–13, 15–18—holotype, 14—paratype (Binh Chau-Phuoc Buu National Park). 10—anal tube, lateral view; 11—anal tube, dorsal view; 12—pygofer lobe, lateral view; 13—genital valve, ventral view; 14—right subgenital plate, dorsal view; 15—subgenital plates, ventral view; 16—style, lateral view; 17—aedeagus, ventral view; 18—aedeagus, lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution. Southeastern Vietnam : Ðồng Nai and Bà Rịa-ũng Tàu Provinces.

Differential diagnosis. The new species is closely related to
T. malayus ( Stål, 1859 ) sensu Evans (1981)
based on the male pygofer lobes with horn-shaped processes on the corners, the aedeagal base convex, and the aedeagal shaft with pair of short apical processes ( Evans 1981 , figs 33B, 33C), but distinctly differs by the different shape of the lateral processes of the male anal tube, slender style apex, gonopore near the middle of the aedeagal shaft, and face with only one black stripe ( Fig. 3 ), while
T. malayus sensu Evans (1981
, fig. 33A) has several black markings on the face ( Fig. 25 ).
